string.text: Ty schłusiŭ. Uhoda skasavana. Hunnar, rabi ź im, što chočaš.
Pahražaješ? Ty nie atrymaješ ani kapiejki ad maich dziadziaŭ, kali naškodziš mnie.

Zaraz Hunar kaža, što jany navat horšyja za karaloŭ i jarłaŭ, ź jakimi my zmahalisia, bo rabujuć uźbiarežnych ziemlarobaŭ i rybakoŭ. Niama honaru ŭ napadie na słabych, - jon stolki razoŭ kazaŭ mnie. I jon, viadoma, mieŭ racyju - prosta ŭ ich značna lahčej adabrać bahaćcie!
Trenieroŭka Trapnaści
Adviazi mianie ŭ Ościkan zaraz

Naš zachopleny karabiel, Załataja Asa, chutki dy manieŭrany i na im ustalavana balista. Kali my maksimalna ablehčym jaho, prybraŭšy ŭvieś hruz, i pasadzim na viosły našych najdužych vieślaroŭ, to zmožam paźbiehnuć zapalenaj smały i padpłyści na adlehłaść strełu. Potym my zmožam vykarystać balistu, kab pa čarzie źniščyć manhaneli, a kali ŭsie jany buduć zrujnavany, našy paplečniki uvarvucca na bort i začyściać pałuby.
Jaki naš hrand płan?
Vyjści z Siužetnaha Režymu

Kali ty sapraŭdy chočaš papłyści z nami, ja z zadavalnieńniem vaźmu ciabie. Ale ja maju tolki adno miesca. Tamu, kali maješ kampańjonaŭ, tabie daviadziecca pakinuć ich u hetym porcie. Biez sumnievu, ty chutka vierniešsia, kab uzjadnacca ź imi, {?PLAYER.GENDER}žyvoj i zdarovaj{?}žyvym i zdarovym{\?}.
{.Muzcynski}Džyn-Haspadar
Nam treba abdumać heta, ale, mažliva, pakinuć Krusasa z nami budzie navat karysna, bo jon moža pahutaryć z Puryham i jaho kamandaj.
{SISTER.NAME}… Heta ty? Heta ja!
{.Zanocy}Łamija
Pieramažycie Padmacavańni
Ciapier ty ŭ biaśpiecy. Adpačni. Pahutarym potym.

Takim čynam… Chaču pradstavić ciabie svajho staroha znajomaha, Sałaŭtasa Krusasa, jaki zdaŭsia, kali apošni jaho čałaviek zahinuŭ ad našych miačoŭ. Jon padajecca vielmi ŭpeŭnienym u sabie dla čałavieka ŭ jaho stanoviščy i, biez sumnievu, budzie sprabavać vykrucicca z niepryjemnaj situacyi pahrozami.

{PLAYER.NAME}… Dyk… Ja spraŭdziŭ słovy Fachdy pra Vłandyjskich pirataŭ, što pracujuć na Puryha, i płanujuć skraści Sturhijskaje srebra. Niekalki bujnych patrulnych vajskovych karabloŭ byli zaŭvažany kala {SETTLEMENT_LINK}. Padazraju, heta Vłandyjcy.
Fłot Handlara
{?PLAYER.GENDER}Hatova{?}Hatovy{\?} adpłyści ŭ Anhranfjord, kab ažyćciavić naš płan? Puryh, chutčej za ŭsio, nia budzie tam doŭha čakać.
{.Muzcynski}Hodny Rotbard
Sačy za haryzontam i vyhledžvaj vietrazi.
Vykinutyja karabli dajuć upłyŭ.
Zabiejcie achoŭnikaŭ jak maha niezaŭvažniej.
Pośpiech! Vy pieramahli fłot Fachdy.
Ja {?PLAYER.GENDER}hatova{?}hatovy{\?} da dueli.
Ja pakul nie {?PLAYER.GENDER}hatova{?}hatovy{\?} da płavańnia.
Vydatna! Daj joj jašče adnu, na pośpiech.
{#GENDER(NAME)}Zieoniski{#}Zieoniskaja{#}Zieoniskaje{#}Zieoniskija{\#} {NAME}
{VALUE}% zarobak vieršnikaŭ padčas płavańnia.
Ja Sałaŭtas Krusas. Ja płavaju pad achovaj Marskich Hančakoŭ. Kali zabješ mianie, tabie nie pazdarovicca.

Na moj pahlad, sapraŭdny vajar viedaje svaju siłu. Jamu nia treba, kab inšyja napaminali jamu pra jaho honar. Jon viedaje, što časam na vajnie byvajuć niaŭdačy — tvoj karabiel spaźniŭsia, ciabie źniesła ŭ śpiešcy ŭciokaŭ, ciabie pieramoh haspadar, čyje siły našmat pierasiahali tvaje.
{.Mnozny}Listy Raspravy
{.Nijaki}Biedstva Moraŭ
My viadziom vajnu suprać Marskich Hančakoŭ, pirackaj kanfiederacyi.
{#GENDER(NAME)}Ościkanski{#}Ościkanskaja{#}Ościkanskaje{#}Ościkanskija{\#} {NAME}
Fłahmanski karabiel daje bonus usim chaŭrusnym karablam.
{.Muzcynski}Bieły Dramader
Krusas! Krok napierad.
vandroŭnych skaldaŭ

Ja padazraju, što Puryh pasprabuje spłyści jak maha dalej adsiul. Mahčyma, na poŭdzień ci ŭschod… Mahčyma, ja budu šukać jaho hadami, a moža, staraść dahonić mianie ŭ darozie ci na mory. Ja nia viedaju, ci sustreniemsia my znoŭ.
{VALUE}% da płavalnaj ciahavitaści kamandy.
{.Zanocy}Marskaja Arda
{.Muzcynski}Niasučy Hora
Byvajcie i pośpiechu.
Brusy ŭ tvajoj kletcy vyhladajuć toŭstymi. Ja ciapier nia maju času, kab vybić ich.
{.Nijaki}Marskoje Bambavańnie
Vłandyjskija Piraty

Cudoŭna. Spadziajusia, ty niekali znojdzieš svaich rodnych. Słuchaj, što b ni zdaryłasia ŭ Chvalvikie, ja viarnusia siudy i pasprabuju znajści inšych vajaroŭ, jakija dapamohuć mnie. Kali niekali razdumaješ, šukaj mianie tut, u Ościkanie.
{NAME} Paŭdniovych Vyspaŭ
To bok, heta infarmacyja karysnaja dla vas, tak? Kali dadać da jaje vykup, pra jaki ja kazaŭ, hetaha chopić, kab vykupić majo žyćcio i volu?
Vyzvalicie pałonnych karabla, kab było mažliva adpłysci na im u biaśpiečnaje miesca.
{.Zanocy}Ruka Karabieła
Zachapicie Handlara Krusasa
Košt kupli i palapšeńnia karabloŭ haspadarskaha kłanu źnižany na 10%{newline}Vytvorčaść draŭlanych i kavalskich majsterniaŭ źnižana na 5% pa ŭsim haspadarstvie
Heta apošni ź ich!
{VALUE} limit karabloŭ, jakimi lha kiravać.
Sabrać Padmacavańni
{.Muzcynski}Nahlfar-Budaŭničy

Dobra, niekatoryja braty pasłuchali jaho, tyja, chto vajavaŭ suprać Volbjorna i kamu bahataja zdabyča, prypraŭlenaja pomstaj, zdavałasia vielmi pryvabnaj. Ale astatnija… My čuli padobnyja abiacańni i raniej i nie žadali słužyć nivodnamu haspadaru. Lepiej vajavać za zołata… a kali chočaš, kab zołata ciakło rakoj, ty musiš vykonvać svaje damovy, navat kali šykoŭny Kalradyjski handlar prapanuje tabie bahaćci siami moraŭ.
Vy znachodziciesia ŭ porcie
{.Nijaki}Niepieramožnaje Sonca

Uzdoŭž źvilistych rečyščaŭ vialikaj raki, što raśsiakaje step, vaša siamja žyła ŭ vady. Karystajučysia maleńkimi samarobnyja płytami i čoŭnami, jany navučylisia ŭvažliva nazirać za bahaćciami raki, źbirajučy peŭnyja rasliny ź jaje bierahoŭ i łoviačy rybu na płytkavodździ. Ad svaich ścipłych baćkoŭ vy ŭspadkavali bahaty zapas viedaŭ.
Piraty - heta adkidy. Davajcie prosta papłyviom i razhramim ich.
{.Muzcynski}Koń Kitovaha Šlachu
Z takim vielizarnym padviešanym bahaćciem, Sturhijcy majuć racyju, što aściarožničajuć.
zaachvočvać šlachtu rabavać varožuju ziamlu.
{.Zanocy}Čapla
You spent your adolescence helping your uncle with his fishing business, learning the ropes (literally!) of seamanship, from mending nets to hauling in the catch.
Fachdas flagship is going down. Defeat the rest of her fleet.
You declined to join {GANGRADIR.LINK} on his voyage, but may be able to find him later at {SETTLEMENT}.

Heres the detail that would interest you…. In addition to all the other delights that Krusas dangled before us, he also offered to build us ships. Puryh was going to construct them in some northern anchorage called Anhranfjord, where he had brought a large number of captives to work in a shipyard.
Unchain yourself from the oar bench.
You make quick work of the alley thugs, and help their victim to his feet. He seems dazed, but grateful.
{#GENDER(NAME)}Sojmavy{#}Sojmavaja{#}Sojmavaje{#}Sojmavyja{\#} {NAME}
Leaving Story Mode
{.Muzcynski}Račny Nalotnik
{.Muzcynski}Vietranarodžany
Row! Lets not be sitting ducks here.
Edykt Marskoha Dabrabytu
{.Nijaki}Viasło
Bjolgur of Gauksdal! Well met! Are the Skolderbroda working for the merchants of {SETTLEMENT_LINK} now?
{.Muzcynski}Poŭny Sił
{.Muzcynski}Bramnik Rany
Prisoner ship
A fight, you say… I take it that Hunnar and you won?
Utgards Joke
I am still not ready.
Undermanned ({AVAILABLE_CREW}/{NEEDED_CREW})
Reach the ship
Listen, you lot, Im in a bit of a hurry. If I give you a penny each will you stop pestering me?
Hey! Over here! Lets not get separated.

You have arrived in {SETTLEMENT_LINK}. As you sail up the estuary into the harbor, you spot several large ships at anchor in a cove. They look like Vlandian craft, probably the pirates that Fachda told you about. They do not try to give chase, however, possibly because they saw you too late to raise sail, or perhaps because they are lying in wait for more lucrative prey.
Were right behind you! Row, lads, row!
Well, {PLAYER.NAME}… Your sister is free, thank the gods. Puryh may have gotten away, but I doubt the Sea Hounds will be troubling us much more.
{#GENDER(NAME)}Bieły{#}Biełaja{#}Biełaje{#}Biełyja{\#} {NAME}
allowing the ruler to collect a share of the revenue from the sales of ships.
You forced {HERO.NAME} to help you capture Puryhs prisoner ship, promising him nothing. (+{CALCULATING_BONUS_AMOUNT} calculating bonus)
{VALUE} extra ammunition per stack for thrown weapons of the crew.
Reach the open seas by avoiding enemy ships.
Several score, all in good health. Weve been feeding them well, sparing no expense. We take pride in our work.
marakoŭ na kurrachach
{.Muzcynski}Morž
Set all prisoners on the ship free.
Wait, I changed my mind.
{VALUE} loyalty for each fishing boat returning to port.
Kryvavaje Abudžeńnie
{.Muzcynski}Štarmavy Duch
{.Muzcynski}Zaklik Małaka
{VALUE} building material in settlement for each merchant convoy visiting port

Just before I set sail for {SETTLEMENT_LINK}, my brothers and I had a visitor, a merchant named Sałaŭtas Krusas who said he was acting as an “ambassador” for Puryh. He wanted us to break our contract with Balgard and ally with the Sea Hounds instead. He offered a great deal of money, too, and more - we could share in Puryhs grand plan of conquest.
{#GENDER(NAME)}Marski{#}Marskaja{#}Marskoje{#}Marskija{\#} {NAME}
Our fortunes have changed. This morning you were a captive, but now you are a lady of rank.
{.Zanocy}Kavalkada Džyna
Successfully raiding a village grants the raiding clan +5 influence.{newline}For each lord party currently staying in a town owned by the kingdom, town security is reduced by 1 daily
Come down to the ship with me, then! Wind and tide are with us, and I wont tarry long.
{.Mnozny}Zuby Vietru

The alley thugs are too many for you, and knock you to the ground. Before they can finish you off, however, you hear a rush of feet and cries of alarm. The town watch must have heard the commotion, and your assailants make a quick retreat. The watch helps you to your feet and tells you to be more careful. The thugs victim, dazed but apparently unhurt, introduces himself.

Acting on what you learned from Fachda, you and Hunnar sailed to the Sturgian port of Omor. There, you met another of Hunnars old comrades, Bjolgur, a member of the Skolderbroda mercenary brotherhood. Bjolgur hoped to run the silver-ship past the Sea Hounds and enlisted you in his dangerous but effective plan to crash a fireship into their blockading fleet. In exchange, Bjolgur gave you information about a key Sea Hound ally, the imperial merchant Krusas, who he suspected would know more about your sister.
Ship Pulling machine
{.Muzcynski}Łobstar
The ruler is given a share of the revenue whenever one of the great houses of the realm sells a ship.
You no longer have a seaworthy ship. Your party will land on the nearest shore.
{.Muzcynski}Bajavy Klič
{.Muzcynski}Pažyralny Voŭk
Sail to the Skatria Islands off {SETTLEMENT_NAME}
Shipboard ballistas fire during sieges
I am Krusas Sałaŭtas. I seek Puryh of Agilting.
marakoŭ
Heaven bless you, {?PLAYER.GENDER}Sister{?}Brother{\?}! I am ready to do my part, for our family and our future! But I can see your men calling you. Get us to safety, and we will speak again.
No, not yet.
Ściah Kalradyjosa
Kingdom-wide militia generation boost: +25%{newline}Kingdom-wide village production penalty: -5%
Razumieńnie Karabieła
The way is now clear to attack {HERO.NAME}s fleet. Destroy it!
{.Nijaki}Błakitnaje Połymia
{VALUE}% to sail forces in missions.
{.Zanocy}Uchmyłka Achilesa
Ahoy! Its good to have you with us. Weve seen sails, and I reckon that there are still pirates about.

Your men make quick work of the pirates. As the fighting dies down, you find that the Sea Hounds were carrying captives, bound and stashed beneath the rowing benches. You cut their bonds and help them to their feet as your lookouts scan the waters for any sign of the second ship.

Growing up on the harsh Nordic coast, you were trained from a young age to spot enemy sails and signal incoming raids. Agile and quick-witted, you honed your skills with a throwing axe and learned to fight in skirmishes. You dream of joining a raiding party and tasting the glory of conquest.
{VALUE}% fire damage dealt by your ship and crew to enemy sails.
Hey you! Stranger! Would you like to help an old man drive off a few stray dogs here?
Once we get within range, their ballista will pelt us with fiery missiles. Avoid them – even if they just hit the water, the flames will keep burning and can spread to our hull.
You silenced those mangonels! Now lets all move in and board them!
Success! You have run the Sea Hound blockade and reached the sea.
{.Muzcynski}Miadźviedź Viełosa

You are in the Skatrias. The jagged silhouettes of small rocky islands, streaked with gull dung, stretch southwest to the horizon.{NEW_LINE}{NEW_LINE}Through the hazy air you make out the outline of a sail. Its still quite distant, but closing fast. They are clearly Sea Hounds, ready to pounce on anyone who ventures into their hunting grounds in the Skatrias.
You back out of the alley. You could easily escape, but you sense that the thugs will kill the old man.
Let me inspect your ships.
{.Muzcynski}Łotas
I accept your decision. Very well then…
{.Zanocy}Srebnaja Rusałka
You have arrived at Anhranfjord, Puryhs lair.
Yes, take me to Ościkan

You met a Nord warrior named Hunnar, helping him defeat an ambush in a back alley of Ościkan. You decided to join forces with him to battle the Sea Hounds, a pirate confederacy, and hunt for your sister. But no sooner did you set out with him then the two of you were betrayed by his old comrade Puryh, who had joined the Sea Hounds. His men were lax, however, and you were able to break out of captivity and make off with one of his ships.
Find {HERO.NAME} in her hunting grounds in the Gulf of Charas
{VALUE}% melee weapon handling.
Are you ready to deal with those two Sea Hound vessels?
Defeat the Enemy Crew
I dont care about your old wars. You put my sister in a cage.
But that is all for nothing. Instead, the kings of Nordvyg, the men that {QUEST_5_COMPANION.NAME} and I fought, will have the last laugh. So, do you like what youve wrought?
{NAME} Parfumnych Vyspaŭ

{PLAYER.NAME}, welcome! Ive been entertaining the village with tales of our adventurers. If youre looking for recruits, then I doubt youll find a more promising batch than the lads of Lagsholfn. You always have a place by my hearth, old friend.

You return to Ościkan harbor, and tie your ship up at the pier. Besides the Vlandian traders and fishing vessels lies a small Nordic longship. Hunnar tells you that some of his comrades have responded to his call to hunt the Sea Hounds. He tells you he needs to dictate a letter to some others, and asks you to meet him later in the port.
Come now, I couldnt have you dash off to hunt Krusas before the silver got past the Sea Hounds. My brothers named me their emissary, you see, and we diplomats need to be crafty.
{#GENDER(NAME)}Musonny{#}Musonnaja{#}Musonnaje{#}Musonnyja{\#} {NAME}
Naval Auto Battle Combat Penalty Negation Effect
You have successfully escorted the Vlandian merchants to {SETTLEMENT_LINK}.
{.Muzcynski}Viciaź
Listen, though… We need someone to steer the fireship. Id do it myself, but my order wants me to stay close to the silver. Id found a few volunteers whove offered to do it, but they keep sobering up.
{.Nijaki}Sonca Aliksienijosa
{.Zanocy}Ryba-Piła
Defeated corsair parties
{.Muzcynski}Miadźviedź

You arrived at Anhranfjord and put your plan into action. While Krusas bantered with Puryhs men, you and Hunnar swum to his prisoner ship and overcame the guards, sailing your sister to safety. Together with Lahar and Bjolgur you then engaged the Sea Hound fleet in a battle in the fjord. In the end, you fought Puryh himself on his flagship and defeated him in a duel. You ended the Sea Hounds reign of terror, and set your sister free. Hunnar awaits you in Ościkan to say his farewells.
dałučylisia da nalotnikaŭ u roli dazorcy.
pajšli słužyć na hrabiežnym karabli.
{VALUE}% damage dealt by crew to enemy sails.

Ive come to this port seeking warriors and a ship. These men we fought were allies of a pirate gang who call themselves the Sea Hounds. They have been raiding and slaving along the Nordvygs shores, and I intend to go to war with them.
I still have things to do on shore.
{NAME} Paŭnočnych Zorak

So! {PLAYER.NAME}… You did well with that fireship! The silver is on its way to my order, and that bastard Puryh will no doubt be much discomfitted. You helped me out there, so let me see if I can now help you.

Good, very good. With luck, the current shall carry it right into them, and they shall all merrily blaze up like a bonfire at a midwinter feast. The silver ship will make for the open sea, while the rest of us can have it out with any surviving Sea Hounds.
{.Zanocy}Vialikaść
{VALUE}% melee damage dealt by crew when fighting on own ship.
{VALUE} morale for mariner troops at start of battle.
Can I tell Lahar that we are ready to sail? The tide and winds are with us, and it would be a pity if someone else were to hunt down Fachda and claim the bounty.
Strike hard, boys! Finish them!
{.Zanocy}Rusałka
Youll get your share of Krusas ill-gained wealth, never fear.
Ship Sails
{.Zanocy}Vialikaja Ciecija
{.Muzcynski}Vaładar Rahoŭ
I will join you, and we can hunt together.
Skatria Islands
{VALUE}% to weight of mounts when in ships cargo.
{.Zanocy}Ustojlivaść
Hailing point
Your allies were defeated. You will have to try again.
Youll just have to try and see.
Sojm i Narod
Speak to Hunnar and Your Sister
{VALUE}% extra ammo for crew.
Your family builded longships for the Sturgian river lords. You grew up amidst the sounds of hammering and the smell of tar, learning the craft of shipbuilding from your father and uncles.
Ach. We couldnt catch Fachda in time.
I need a bit more time.
Did you see that big fiery ball? Not very accurate, Ill warrant, but if one of our ships gets hit by one of those… Those who dont jump into the sea in time will die a nasty death.
Ahoy to you, Hunnar! An exemplary escape! Is the captive safe?
All clans within the kingdom benefit from a -15% reduction in ship purchase costs on own kingdoms ports.{newline}-10% tariff income
Rybaki {VILLAGE_NAME}

The clang of hammer on hot iron was the defining sound of your upbringing. Your family were more than mere smiths; they were artisans who coaxed wonders from limited resources, shaping valuable iron into formidable weapons and treasured tools. From the forge, you learned to work with what little you had, understanding the unique properties of each piece and the almost magical skill required to transform it.
{#GENDER(NAME)}Błakitny{#}Błakitnaja{#}Błakitnaje{#}Błakitnyja{\#} {NAME}
Cannot leave story mode due to war.
{#GENDER(NAME)}Akijaničny{#}Akijaničnaja{#}Akijaničnaje{#}Akijaničnyja{\#} {NAME}
{.Muzcynski}Srebny Vuhor
What are you doing now?
{.Muzcynski}Žarabiec Ultajhi
Cannot leave story mode due to ongoing siege.
Thank the Heavens. And thank you. Those Sea Hound vessels would have torn us to pieces. You came just in time.
{.Muzcynski}Vrykałakas
{.Muzcynski}Skohat Tryta
Go for her flagship! We dont want it to get away! Well deal with the lesser vessels later.
So… You are the captain who thrashed those so-called Sea Hounds up north. I have a proposal that I hope would be of interest to a man such as you.
Defeat Krusas men in the battle aboard the floating fortress

The Sea Hounds, I hear, theyve mostly scattered. Its time for me to return to my home in Beinland. Ive settled what I wish to settle, and all this rowing and ramming and climbing and jostling and fighting is hard on my old bones.
{#GENDER(NAME)}Vostrumski{#}Vostrumskaja{#}Vostrumskaje{#}Vostrumskija{\#} {NAME}
granting the ruler a share of all ransoms.
If you think theyre sick youre welcome not to buy any.
Enter the hold of the ship.
Im going to free you, and kill every last one of those slavers!
Ill go do that.
{VALUE}% to hearth growth rate in coastal villages
Well, {PLAYER.NAME}… Your sister is free, thank the gods. You gave Puryh a far more honorable death than he deserved. Men will speak well of you.

Each day, a pirate party operating within the kingdoms coastline has a 5% chance to surrender to the nearest coastal town. Upon surrendering, its ships are donated to the towns shipyard, and its members join the towns garrison.{newline}For each surrendered pirate party that settlements security is immediately decreased by 5.
{.Zanocy}Paznaka Julhiena
Armies that are commanded by a Nord commander lose 30% more cohesion on land.
I am as ready as I will ever be, I suppose.
Easy there, grandpa. Hand off your sword hilt.
{VALUE}% ranged damage dealt by character.
{.Muzcynski}Čyrvony Pievień
Your fleet will be here in {HOURS} {?(HOURS > 1)}hours{?}hour{\?}!
Keep watch for approaching enemy ships.
{VALUE}% to production of fish at villages governed of the governed settlement.
{.Muzcynski}Aroł
Partyja Puryha
{.Muzcynski}Hrukat Hromu
{.Zanocy}Łamna
A coastal guard force stands ready to assist allies in battles within the towns territorial waters{newline}Coastal town garrisons wages are increased by 15%

Do you see that big cluster of ships back there? Thats got to be where theyre holding the prisoners. That smaller vessel out front, though - thats got to be a picket, and it will stop us before we get too close. Lets approach it, pretending to be a buyer, while Bjolgur and Lahar stay out of sight. Krusas can banter with them a bit as a distraction. One of our men shall stand at his side with a dagger, lest he betray us.
Youre not the only buyer, my friend! Mines, buildings, repairs… Even on the mainland, mix a handful of our fellows in with some convicts or war captives, and whos to notice?
You pass out from the pain of your wounds.
{VALUE}% accuracy penalty from ship roll.
{.Muzcynski}Viarblud Nachasy

Youll need to wait for our master to return before you start bargaining. Dont push your friendship with Puryh too much, though - hes got expensive tastes. He likes to see the envy in other mens eyes when the sun sparkles off his fine golden helm.
You are at the port.
{.Zanocy}Mudraść
When we get close, I will set fire to our ship and then we swim to shore.

Are you really a farmer, now? Callouses such as those on your hands are made by oars, not ploughs. And I see a scar on your sword-arm that doesnt look like it came from the kick of a mule. Indeed, I might even recall your name. Hralgar Eel-Nose, is it not?
{.Muzcynski}Źniščalnik-Vorahaŭ
Sounds like good fun. Ill do it.
{VALUE}% to campaign map speed of towns fishing boats.
All is good? Packed your bag, kissed your mother and your sweetheart good-bye? Of course my lads and I wont mind if you want to tarry here a little longer. Oh no. Theres no hurry at all.
Return to {SETTLEMENT_NAME}
Naval combat morale of lord parties is increased by 20%{newline}Troop XP gain is reduced by 15%
Efiektyŭny Kapitan

Your family was a tight-knit crew on a sturdy fishing vessel. They werent charting uncharted seas, but venturing just beyond the familiar fjords, bartering with coastal settlements for smoked fish and bragging rights about the biggest catch. Each plank and sail held the legacy of generations, passed down through calloused hands and the rhythmic tap of the hammer.

You were born into a family of foresters living off the land. You learned to track prey, hunt for sustenance and gathering herbs and mushrooms from a young age. The forest provided, but it also demanded respect. You learned the medicinal properties of plants and mushrooms for the inevitable scrapes and ailments that came with life in the wild. The harsh environment became your teacher, and survival your greatest lesson.

War was a constant presence in your village. You served as a shieldbearer to a renowned Huscarl, a veteran Nord warrior. Witnessing countless battles and learning the art of defense from a master, you yearn to prove yourself worthy of wielding a weapon in the front lines.

Listen. Ive been watching these Vlandian blockaders, and mulling over a plan. Their flagship has a lofty deck and it would be hard to board, but it doesnt seem very maneuverable. I think we can hit them with a trick that can be deadly in estuaries.

I cant think why a merchant would want to anchor there, were they not the site of these sulfur mines where the captives are sent.{NEW_LINE}{NEW_LINE}So… I say we set out for these islands and hunt for Krusas.

As you cut Puryh down, there is a moment of silence. Then a great cheer wells up from your men. Hunnar closes his eyes and offers a muttered prayer to his gods. Meanwhile, with your sister foremost in your mind, you hurry back to the roundship.

The letter, though, was addressed to one of my very old friends, Bjolgur of Agilting. When he left the rebellion he chose neither peace nor banditry. He chose, instead, to join the Skolderbroda, the Shield Brothers. Rather than fight for a king, he said, he would fight for whoever pays him. A king may turn out to be unworthy of his warriors valor, but gold is never unworthy.

You arrived at Anhranfjord and put your plan into action. While Krusas bantered with Puryhs men, you and Hunnar swum to his prisoner ship and overcame the guards, sailing your sister to safety. Together with Lahar and Bjolgur you then engaged the Sea Hound fleet in a battle in the fjord. In the end, you fought Puryh himself on his flagship but spared his life after he bested you in one-to-one combat. You ended the Sea Hounds reign of terror, and set your sister free. Hunnar awaits you in Ościkan to say his farewells.

You have reached the Gulf of Charas. Winds whip across the waves, carrying dust from the deserts, and visibility comes and goes. Lahars ship keeps station several bowshots off of your port side, and together you comb the seas for the corsairs.

A brief squall cuts visibility to a few bowshots, and when it clears, you see that two Sea Hound vessels have snuck up upon the merchants ship and are in hot pursuit. They are much faster, so unless you can close and defeat them or draw them off, it is likely that your ally will be taken.
Once again, you are victorious. Hunnar, meanwhile, inspects the fallen pirates, and soon finds one who is only lightly wounded and able to speak.

Very well. Should we arrive safely, we will happily show our gratitude with a contribution to your cause. The wind is brisk and the waves are choppy, so try not to venture too far away… May the Heavens protect us from pirates and the perils of the sea.

[if:convo_predatory][ib:warrior]Hunnar of Langshofn… Three of your old shipmates have we visited while reeving. One died well. The others… Its said that your people are mean and stingy hosts, but those two gave us some fine entertainment.

We arrived in Ościkan. We were smuggled in by night, as the slave trade was banned by the Vlandian king, though many there clearly profited from it. Eventually Puryh came to buy us. He questioned all of us closely, about our families. At first I thought he was trying to find out whether he could get a ransom for us, but no, he was trying to find someone related to you! He feared you, and was keeping me to protect himself from you! That made me proud, despite my misery.
Farewell. Perhaps I will take you up on your reputation.

Born into a Calradia perpetually at war, you didnt know playgrounds, you knew battlefields. Survival as a youngster meant picking through the battlefields. You learned to be self-sufficient, sometimes tending to wounds amidst the carnage. The law of the battlefield was simple: take what you can, and dont get caught.

What have you done? Do you know who I am? I have allies wholl unthread your entrails from your guts and hang you with them from your own yardarm. I am queen of these waters, you fools, and those who practice piracy here without my permission end up chum to attract the sharks.

Its hard to believe now, but they were once my brothers-in-arms. . Years ago we fought side-by-side in the last great rebellion in the north. Most of the clans and many freemen like myself refused to bow to Volbjorn the usurper, as he was then called. But Volbjorn knew how to speak to mens desires. He won over the bigger clans with promises of land and silver, and when summer came and he brought a fleet to give us battle, he had with him so many long ships that their sails covered the horizon. We still fought them of course, but their numbers were too many to beat.

Puryh, a leader among the Sea Hounds! Ill speak straight here - it gnaws at my gut to hear that he is prospering from his treachery.

The lady is good at her craft. Fachda has been sailing since she was a child. She always wears a sailors cap, and underneath she is as bald as an egg. She persuaded her late father to take her to sea, so the story goes, by cutting off all of her long shining hair lest it catch in the rigging. Often, when you were growing up, you wondered if your destiny might lie upon the sea. You listened closely to old sailors telling their tales of daring and peril: steering longships through the icy storms of the north, outfoxing corsairs along the pirate-infested coasts of the south, or standing in the forecastle of a dromon as it crashed through the enemy battle-line. You wonder what opportunities lie for you to seize on the seas of Calradia: a fortune made in the commerce and intrigues of a bustling port, or glory won on the bloodied deck of a foes flagship.
issuing an edict granting special privileges to enterprises in coastal towns.

You grew up in a coastal village, surrounded by tales of legendary Viking warriors and their daring voyages. As a youth, you learned the skills of a sailor, a warrior, and a raider, preparing for the day when you would join your kin on a voyage of exploration and conquest.

When last we met, I was intending to sail with my old friend Puryh. Well, I always fancied myself a good judge of character, but I suppose fond memories of my warlike youth went to my head like ale. Puryh betrayed me. Like so many of my comrades from those days, he turned Sea Hound. I escaped his clutches however, and returned here. I know a great deal more about their operations.
Thats fine, but I was expecting more.
You tell me all you know about the Sea Hounds and their dealings in slaves.

“A ship! A ship!” calls out one of your lookouts. You can see it too - a square sail, outlined against the steel-gray northern sky. One of the Sea Hounds stalking the merchant seems to be closing in on its prey.

With enemy forces constantly threatening your village, you spent your youth helping fortify the local hold. One of your sharper-eyed sailors thinks he sees a ship. You stare at the horizon, and though at first its hard to make out shapes against the choppy waves of the gulf, you eventually distinguish the unmistakable outline of a lateen sail. Its a corsair, and its heading directly towards you.

My men, though… Well, some of them have been quite impressed by your leadership. They want to follow you, if youll have them. And as I mentioned, they prefer to sail on our ship here, the Wave-Steed, so I guess thats yours too, if youll have it. Shell carry you well, especially in the rough seas of the north.
They must think were just a fishing vessel. All right now, boys, lets show them that their prey has teeth of its own!

The north is not forgiving of those who throw away their good name. Their old life, where they were feared rather than scorned, must have seemed much sweeter in comparison. And of course they conceived a great resentment against those of us who faced death and showed them up as cowards. These are the ones who became the Sea Hounds, who aimed to steal the wealth and glory that they failed to win in battle.

That captive we took, Hralgar, said that the Sea Hounds expect to find rich pickings near Beinland. I think I know what he is talking about. Every year, a Vlandian merchant ship travels to the far north, bearing hunters and other fortune-seekers. It should be returning south around this time. These men have spent the last months gathering walrus ivory, fur and whale oil, all of which are quite valuable in the southlands.

Anyway, I had originally wanted to join up with a merchant returning to Vlandia from Chvalvik, and I think that plan is still a good one. His company has spent the last months hunting and whaling in the far north, and their ship is laden with valuables. I am certain that the Sea Hounds will be unable to resist such a tempting target.
How do we counter this?
